q.definition: the 17th letter of the Roman alphabet

qaddafi.definition: Libyan leader who seized power in a military coup d'etat in 1969; deposed the Libyan monarchy and imposed socialism and Islamic orthodoxy on the country (born in 1942)

qatar.definition:
1) an Arab country on the peninsula of Qatar; achieved independence from the United Kingdom in 1971; the economy is dominated by oil
2) a peninsula extending northward from the Arabian mainland into the Persian Gulf

qibla.definition:
1) the direction of the Kaaba toward which Muslims turn for their daily prayers
2) a small terrorist group of Muslims in South Africa formed in the 1980s; was inspired by Ayatollah Khomeini to create an Islamic state in South Africa

qoph.definition: the 19th letter of the Hebrew alphabet

quack.definition:
1) medically unqualified
2) act as a medical quack or a charlatan

examples.en: a quack doctor

quackery.definition: medical practice and advice based on observation and experience in ignorance of scientific findings

quad.definition:
3) (printing) a block of type without a raised letter; used for spacing between words or sentences
4) a rectangular area surrounded on all sides by buildings

quadrangular.definition: of or relating to or shaped like a quadrangle

quadrant.definition:
1) a quarter of the circumference of a circle
2) any of the four areas into which a plane is divided by two orthogonal coordinate axes
3) the area enclosed by two perpendicular radii of a circle

examples.en: his quadraphonic sound system

quadrate.definition:
1) having four sides and four angles
2) a square-shaped object

quadratic.definition:
1) of or relating to or resembling a square
2) of or relating to the second power

examples.en: quadratic shapes
quadratic equation

quadratics.definition: a branch of algebra dealing with quadratic equations

quadrature.definition: the construction of a square having the same area as some other figure

quadriceps.definition: a muscle of the thigh that extends the leg

quadrille.definition:
1) music for dancing the quadrille
2) a square dance of 5 or more figures for 4 or more couples

quadrillion.definition:
1) the number that is represented as a one followed by 24 zeros
2) the number that is represented as a one followed by 15 zeros

examples.en: in England they call a septillion a quadrillion

quadrillionth.definition: the ordinal number of one quadrillion in counting order

quadriplegia.definition: paralysis of both arms and both legs

quadriplegic.definition: a person who is paralyzed in both arms and both legs

quadric.definition: a curve or surface whose equation (in Cartesian coordinates) is of the second degree

quadrivium.definition: (Middle Ages) a higher division of the curriculum in a medieval university involving arithmetic and music and geometry and astronomy

quadroon.definition: an offspring of a mulatto and a white parent; a person who is one-quarter black

quadruped.definition: an animal especially a mammal having four limbs specialized for walking

quadruple.definition:
1) having four units or components
2) four times as great or many

examples.en: quadruple rhythm has four beats per measure
quadruplex wire
a fourfold increase in the dosage

quadruplet.definition: one of four children born at the same time from the same pregnancy

examples.en: quadruplicate the bill

quadrupling.definition: increase by a factor of four

quaestor.definition: any of several public officials of ancient Rome (usually in charge of finance and administration)

quagga.definition: mammal of South Africa that resembled a zebra; extinct since late 19th century

quahaug.definition: Atlantic coast round clams with hard shells; large clams usually used for chowders or other clam dishes

quahog.definition: an edible American clam; the heavy shells were used as money by some American Indians

quay.definition: wharf usually built parallel to the shoreline

quail.definition:
1) flesh of quail; suitable for roasting or broiling if young; otherwise must be braised
2) small gallinaceous game birds

quaint.definition:
1) strange in an interesting or pleasing way
2) very strange or unusual; odd or even incongruous in character or appearance

examples.en: quaint dialect words
quaint streets of New Orleans, that most foreign of American cities
the head terminating in the quaint duck bill which gives the animal its vernacular name"- Bill Beatty
came forth a quaint and fearful sight"- Sir Walter Scott

quaintly.definition:
1) in a strange but not unpleasant manner
2) in a quaint old-fashioned manner

examples.en: the old lady expressed herself somewhat quaintly
the room was quaintly furnished

quaintness.definition:
1) the quality of being quaint and old-fashioned; its quaintness was appealing"
2) strangeness as a consequence of being old fashioned

examples.en: she liked the old cottage
some words in her dialect had a charming quaintness

quaker.definition: one who quakes and trembles with (or as with) fear

quakerism.definition: the theological doctrine of the Society of Friends characterized by opposition to war and rejection of ritual and a formal creed and an ordained ministry

qualify.definition:
1) prove capable or fit; meet requirements
2) pronounce fit or able
3) make more specific

examples.en: She was qualified to run the marathon
They nurses were qualified to administer the injections
qualify these remarks

qualification.definition:
1) an attribute that must be met or complied with and that fits a person for something
2) the act of modifying or changing the strength of some idea

examples.en: her qualifications for the job are excellent
one of the qualifications for admission is an academic degree
his new position involves a qualification of his party's platform

qualified.definition:
1) meeting the proper standards and requirements and training for an office or position or task
2) limited or restricted; not absolute

examples.en: many qualified applicants for the job
gave only qualified approval

qualifier.definition: a contestant who meets certain requirements and so qualifies to take part in the next stage of competition

examples.en: the tournament was won by a late qualifier

qualitative.definition:
1) involving distinctions based on qualities
2) relating to or involving comparisons based on qualities

examples.en: qualitative change
qualitative data
this discoloration qualitatively suggests that the substance is low in inorganic iron

quality.definition:
1) an essential and distinguishing attribute of something or someone
2) of high social status
3) a characteristic property that defines the apparent individual nature of something

examples.en: the quality of mercy is not strained"--Shakespeare
people of quality
a quality family
each town has a quality all its own
the radical character of our demands

quandong.definition:
1) Australian tree with edible flesh and edible nutlike seed
2) the fruit of the Brisbane quandong tree
3) Australian tree having hard white timber and glossy green leaves with white flowers followed by one-seeded glossy blue fruit

quango.definition: a quasi nongovernmental organization; an organization that is financed by the government yet acts independently of the government

quantal.definition: of or relating to a quantum or capable of existing in only one of two states

quantic.definition: a homogeneous polynomial having at least two variables

quantify.definition:
1) use as a quantifier
2) express as a number or measure or quantity

examples.en: Can you quantify your results?

quantification.definition:
1) a limitation imposed on the variables of a proposition (as by the quantifiers `some' or `all' or `no')
2) the act of discovering or expressing the quantity of something

quantifier.definition:
1) (logic) a word (such as `some' or `all' or `no') that binds the variables in a logical proposition
2) (grammar) a word that expresses a quantity (as `fifteen' or `many')

quantitative.definition:
1) expressible as a quantity or relating to or susceptible of measurement
2) relating to the measurement of quantity
3) (of verse) having a metric system based on relative duration of syllables

examples.en: export wheat without quantitative limitations
quantitative analysis determines the amounts and proportions of the chemical constituents of a substance or mixture
quantitative studies
in typical Greek and Latin verse of the classical period the rhymic system is based on some arrangement of long and short elements
this can be expressed quantitatively

quantity.definition:
2) an adequate or large amount
3) the concept that something has a magnitude and can be represented in mathematical expressions by a constant or a variable

examples.en: he had a quantity of ammunition

quantization.definition: the act of dividing into quanta or expressing in terms of quantum theory

quantize.definition:
1) approximate (a signal varying continuously in amplitude) by one whose amplitude is restricted to a prescribed set of discrete values
2) apply quantum theory to; restrict the number of possible values of (a quantity) or states of (a physical entity or system) so that certain variables can assume only certain discrete magnitudes that are integral multiples of a common factor

examples.en: Quantize gravity

quantum.definition:
1) a discrete amount of something that is analogous to the quantities in quantum theory
2) (physics) the smallest discrete quantity of some physical property that a system can possess (according to quantum theory)

quapaw.definition:
1) a member of the Siouan people of the Arkansas river valley in Arkansas
2) the Dhegiha dialect spoken by the Quapaw

quarantine.definition:
1) place into enforced isolation, as for medical reasons
2) isolation to prevent the spread of infectious disease

examples.en: My dog was quarantined before he could live in England

quark.definition: (physics) hypothetical truly fundamental particle in mesons and baryons; there are supposed to be six flavors of quarks (and their antiquarks), which come in pairs; each has an electric charge of +2/3 or -1/3

examples.en: quarks have not been observed directly but theoretical predictions based on their existence have been confirmed experimentally

quarrel.definition:
1) have a disagreement over something
2) an arrow that is shot from a crossbow; has a head with four edges

examples.en: We quarreled over the question as to who discovered America
These two fellows are always scrapping over something
arguing children
quarrelsome when drinking

quarrelsomeness.definition: an inclination to be quarrelsome and contentious

quarry.definition: extract (something such as stones) from or as if from a quarry

examples.en: quarry marble

quarrying.definition: the extraction of building stone or slate from an open surface quarry

quarryman.definition: a man who works in a quarry

quart.definition:
1) a United States liquid unit equal to 32 fluid ounces; four quarts equal one gallon
2) a British imperial capacity measure (liquid or dry) equal to 2 pints or 1.136 liters
3) a United States dry unit equal to 2 pints or 67.2 cubic inches

quartan.definition: occurring every fourth day (especially the fever and weakness of malaria)

examples.en: quartan malaria

quarter.definition:
1) provide housing for (military personnel)
2) a district of a city having some distinguishing character
3) divide into quarters

examples.en: the Latin Quarter
quarter an apple

quarterback.definition:
1) play the quarterback
2) (American football) the position of the football player in the backfield who directs the offensive play of his team

examples.en: quarterback is the most important position on the team

quarterdeck.definition: the stern area of a ship's upper deck

quarterfinal.definition: one of the four competitions in an elimination tournament whose winners go on to play in the semifinals

quartering.definition:
1) a coat of arms that occupies one quarter of an escutcheon; combining four coats of arms on one shield usually represented intermarriages
2) living accommodations (especially those assigned to military personnel)
3) dividing into four equal parts

quarterly.definition:
1) in diagonally opposed quarters of an escutcheon
2) in three month intervals

examples.en: two coats of arms borne quarterly
interest is compounded quarterly

quarterlight.definition: car window consisting of a small pivoted glass vent in the door of a car

quartermaster.definition: an army officer who provides clothing and subsistence for troops

quarterstaff.definition: a long stout staff used as a weapon

quartet.definition:
2) four performers or singers who perform together
3) a set of four similar things considered as a unit
4) four people considered as a unit

examples.en: he joined a barbershop quartet
the foursome teed off before 9 a.m.

quartile.definition: (statistics) any of three points that divide an ordered distribution into four parts each containing one quarter of the scores

quarto.definition: the size of a book whose pages are made by folding a sheet of paper twice to form four leaves

quartz.definition: a hard glossy mineral consisting of silicon dioxide in crystal form; present in most rocks (especially sandstone and granite); yellow sand is quartz with iron oxide impurities

quartzite.definition: hard metamorphic rock consisting essentially of interlocking quartz crystals

quartzose.definition: relating to or made of quartz

quasar.definition: a starlike object that may send out radio waves and other forms of energy; many have large red shifts

examples.en: a quasi success
a quasi contract

quasiparticle.definition: a quantum of energy (in a crystal lattice or other system) that has position and momentum and can in some respects be regarded as a particle

quasi-royal.definition: having the power but not the rank or title of a king

examples.en: one of the quasi-royal rulers of Africa

quassia.definition:
1) a bitter compound used as an insecticide and tonic and vermifuge; extracted from the wood and bark of trees of the genera Quassia and Picrasma
2) handsome South American shrub or small tree having bright scarlet flowers and yielding a valuable fine-grained yellowish wood; yields the bitter drug quassia from its wood and bark

quaternate.definition: consisting of or especially arranged in sets of four

examples.en: quaternate leaves
a quaternary compound

quattrocento.definition: the 15th century in Italian art and literature

quaver.definition: give off unsteady sounds, alternating in amplitude or frequency

quavering.definition: (of the voice) quivering as from weakness or fear

examples.en: the old lady's quavering voice
spoke timidly in a tremulous voice
the man began quaveringly to question the soldier
`Do I have to remove the liver,' the medical student asked queasily

quebec.definition:
1) the French-speaking capital of the province of Quebec; situated on the Saint Lawrence River
2) the largest province of Canada; a French colony from 1663 to 1759 when it was lost to the British

quebecois.definition: of or relating to Quebec (especially to the French speaking inhabitants or their culture)

quechua.definition:
1) a member of a South American Indian people in Peru who were formerly the ruling class of the Inca empire
2) a community of South American Indians in Peru who were formerly the ruling class of the Incan Empire
3) the language of the Quechua which was spoken by the Incas

quechuan.definition: of or relating to the Quechua or their language

queen.definition:
1) promote to a queen, as of a pawn in chess
2) become a queen
3) the wife or widow of a king

examples.en: her pawn queened

queenly.definition: having the rank of or resembling or befitting a queen

examples.en: queenly propriety
clad in her queenly raiment

queens.definition: a borough of New York City

queer.definition: put in a dangerous, disadvantageous, or difficult position

queerly.definition:
1) in a strange manner
2) in a questionably unusual manner

examples.en: a queerly inscribed sheet of paper
this money had been queerly come by
quell my hunger
the quelled rebellion
an uprising quenched almost before it started

quellung.definition: the swelling of the capsule surrounding a microorganism after reaction with an antibody; the basis of certain tests for identifying microorganisms

examples.en: pneumococcus quellung

quench.definition:
1) satisfy (thirst)
3) electronics: suppress (sparking) when the current is cut off in an inductive circuit, or suppress (an oscillation or discharge) in a component or device
5) reduce the degree of (luminescence or phosphorescence) in (excited molecules or a material) by adding a suitable substance

examples.en: The cold water quenched his thirst
his thirst quenched he was able to continue
unquenchable thirst

quercitron.definition: a yellow dye made from the bark of the quercitron oak tree

quern.definition: a primitive stone mill for grinding corn by hand

querulousness.definition: the quality of being given to complaining

quest.definition:
1) make a search (for)
2) search the trail of (game)
4) seek alms, as for religious purposes

examples.en: Things that die with their eyes open and questing
The animal came questing through the forest
The dog went off and quested

question.definition:
1) challenge the accuracy, probity, or propriety of
2) the subject matter at issue
3) pose a question

examples.en: We must question your judgment in this matter
the question of disease merits serious discussion
under the head of minor Roman poets

questionable.definition:
1) subject to question
2) able to be refuted

examples.en: questionable motives
a questionable reputation

questionably.definition: in a questionable and dubious manner

examples.en: these were estates his father questionably acquired

questioning.definition: perplexed (as if being expected to know something that you do not know)

examples.en: he had a quizzical expression

questioningly.definition:
1) in a curious and questioning manner
2) in a quizzical and questioning manner

examples.en: they turned their heads questioningly, as if awaiting further instructions
they looked quizzically at the doctor

questionnaire.definition: a form containing a set of questions; submitted to people to gain statistical information

quetzal.definition:
1) the basic unit of money in Guatemala; equal to 100 centavos
2) large trogon of Central America and South America having golden-green and scarlet plumage

quetzalcoatl.definition: an Aztec deity represented as a plumed serpent

queue.definition:
1) a line of people or vehicles waiting for something
2) (information processing) an ordered list of tasks to be performed or messages to be transmitted
3) a braid of hair at the back of the head

quibble.definition:
1) evade the truth of a point or question by raising irrelevant objections
2) argue over petty things

examples.en: Let's not quibble over pennies

quibbler.definition: a disputant who quibbles; someone who raises annoying petty objections

quiche.definition:
1) a member of the Mayan people of south central Guatemala
2) a tart filled with rich unsweetened custard; often contains other ingredients (as cheese or ham or seafood or vegetables)
3) the Mayan language spoken by the Quiche

quick.definition:
1) accomplished rapidly and without delay
4) apprehending and responding with speed and sensitivity
6) easily aroused or excited

examples.en: was quick to make friends
his quick reaction prevented an accident
a quick mind
a ready wit
a quick temper
a warm temper

quick-change.definition: adept at changing from one thing to another especially changing costumes

examples.en: a quick-change artist

quicken.definition:
3) give life or energy to
4) show signs of life

examples.en: The cold water invigorated him
the fetus quickened

quickener.definition: an agent that gives or restores life or vigor

examples.en: the soul is the quickener of the body

quickening.definition:
1) the process of showing signs of life
2) the stage of pregnancy at which the mother first feels the movements of the fetus

examples.en: the quickening of seed that will become ripe grain

quick-freeze.definition: freeze rapidly so as to preserve the natural juices and flavors

examples.en: quick-freeze the shrimp
he works quickly

quicksand.definition:
1) a treacherous situation that tends to entrap and destroy
2) a pit filled with loose wet sand into which objects are sucked down

quickset.definition: grown from cuttings planted directly in the ground

examples.en: a quickset hawthorn hedge
quick-sighted into the faults of the time"- Leonard Bacon

quickstep.definition:
1) perform a quickstep
2) a ballroom dance with both quick and slow steps

examples.en: quick-witted debater
saved an embarrassing situation with quick-witted tact

quiddity.definition: the essence that makes something the kind of thing it is and makes it different from any other

quiescent.definition:
1) not active or activated
2) marked by a state of tranquil repose
3) being quiet or still or inactive

examples.en: the quiescent level of centimeter wave-length solar radiation
the quiescent melancholy of the town

quiet.definition:
1) characterized by an absence or near absence of agitation or activity
2) free of noise or uproar; or making little if any sound
3) not showy or obtrusive
antonyms: a quiet audience at the concert
the factions remained quiet for almost 10 years
the room was dark and quiet
examples: the factions remained quiet for almost 10 years
a quiet audience at the concert
the room was dark and quiet
quiet.brief: characterized by an absence or near absence of agitation or activity

meanings.definition: characterized by an absence or near absence of agitation or activity
antonyms: the factions remained quiet for almost 10 years
examples: the factions remained quiet for almost 10 years

meanings.definition: free of noise or uproar; or making little if any sound
antonyms: a quiet audience at the concert
the room was dark and quiet
examples: a quiet audience at the concert
the room was dark and quiet

meanings.definition: of the sun characterized by a low level of surface phenomena like sunspots e.g.

examples.en: The audience fell silent when the speaker entered

quietism.definition: a form of religious mysticism requiring withdrawal from all human effort and passive contemplation of God

quietist.definition: a religious mystic who follows quietism

quietly.definition:
2) with little or no sound
3) with little or no activity or no agitation (`quiet' is a nonstandard variant for `quietly')

examples.en: the class was listening quietly and intently
she was crying quietly
her hands rested quietly in her lap
the rock star was quietly led out the back door

quietness.definition: the property of making no sound

quiff.definition: a prominent forelock (especially one brushed upward from the forehead)

quill.definition:
1) pen made from a bird's feather
2) a stiff hollow protective spine on a porcupine or hedgehog
4) the hollow spine of a feather

quillwort.definition: any of several spore-bearing aquatic or marsh plants having short rhizomes and leaves resembling quills; worldwide except Polynesia

quilt.definition:
1) stitch or sew together
2) create by stitching together

examples.en: quilt the skirt

quilted.definition: made of layers of fabric held together by patterned stitching

quilting.definition:
1) stitching through layers of fabric and a filling so as to create a design
2) a material used for making a quilt, or a quilted fabric

quinacrine.definition: a drug (trade name Atabrine) used to treat certain worm infestations and once used to treat malaria

quince.definition:
1) small Asian tree with pinkish flowers and pear-shaped fruit; widely cultivated
2) aromatic acid-tasting pear-shaped fruit used in preserves

quincentennial.definition: of or relating to a 500th anniversary

examples.en: the quincentennial celebration of the founding of the city

quincy.definition: American patriot who presented the colonists' grievances to the English king (1744-1775)

quinidine.definition: cardiac drug (trade names Quinidex and Quinora) used to treat certain heart arrhythmias

quinine.definition: a bitter alkaloid extracted from chinchona bark; used in malaria therapy

quinone.definition: any of a class of aromatic yellow compounds including several that are biologically important as coenzymes or acceptors or vitamins; used in making dyes

quinquagesima.definition: the Sunday before Ash Wednesday (the beginning of Lent)

quinquefoliate.definition: (of a leaf shape) having five leaflets

quinsy.definition: a painful pus filled inflammation of the tonsils and surrounding tissues; usually a complication of tonsillitis

quintal.definition: a unit of weight equal to 100 kilograms

quintessence.definition:
1) the fifth and highest element after air and earth and fire and water; was believed to be the substance composing all heavenly bodies
2) the purest and most concentrated essence of something
3) the most typical example or representative of a type

quintessential.definition: representing the perfect example of a class or quality

quintet.definition:
1) a musical composition for five performers
3) five performers or singers who perform together
4) a set of five similar things considered as a unit

quintillion.definition: the number that is represented as a one followed by 18 zeros

quintillionth.definition: the ordinal number of one quintillion in counting order

quintuplet.definition: one of five children born at the same time from the same pregnancy

quintupling.definition: increasing by a factor of five

quipu.definition: calculator consisting of a cord with attached cords; used by ancient Peruvians for calculating and keeping records

quira.definition: any of several tropical American trees some yielding economically important timber

quire.definition: a quantity of paper; 24 or 25 sheets

quirk.definition:
1) twist or curve abruptly
2) a narrow groove beside a beading

examples.en: She quirked her head in a peculiar way

quirt.definition: whip with a leather thong at the end

quitclaim.definition:
1) document transferring title or right or claim to another
2) act of transferring a title or right or claim to another

quite.definition:
1) to a degree (not used with a negative)
2) to the greatest extent; completely
3) of an unusually noticeable or exceptional or remarkable kind (not used with a negative)

examples.en: quite tasty
quite soon
you're quite right
she was quite alone
her victory was quite something
she's quite a girl

quits.definition: on equal terms by payment or requital

examples.en: we're now quits
finally quits with the loan

quittance.definition: a document or receipt certifying release from an obligation or debt

quitter.definition: a person who gives up too easily

quiver.definition:
1) shake with fast, tremulous movements
3) case for holding arrows

examples.en: His nostrils palpitated

quixotic.definition: not sensible about practical matters; idealistic and unrealistic

examples.en: as quixotic as a restoration of medieval knighthood
a romantic disregard for money
sent to jail for two years, he has quixotically refused to clear himself by betraying his colleagues
The teacher tests us every week
We got quizzed on French irregular verbs

qum.definition: a city in northwestern Iran; a place of pilgrimage for Shiite Muslims

quodlibet.definition: an issue that is presented for formal disputation

quoin.definition:
1) expandable metal or wooden wedge used by printers to lock up a form within a chase
2) the keystone of an arch

quoit.definition: game equipment consisting of a ring of iron or circle of rope used in playing the game of quoits

quoits.definition: a game in which iron rings (or open iron rings) are thrown at a stake in the ground in the hope of encircling it

quoratean.definition: a group of languages of the Hokan family

quorum.definition: a gathering of the minimal number of members of an organization to conduct business

quota.definition:
1) a prescribed number
2) a proportional share assigned to each participant
3) a limitation on imports

examples.en: all the salesmen met their quota for the month
the quota for Japanese imports was negotiated

quotability.definition: the quality of being worthy of being quoted

quotable.definition: suitable for or worthy of quotation

examples.en: a quotable slogan
his remarks are not quotable in mixed company

quotation.definition:
2) a passage or expression that is quoted or cited
3) a statement of the current market price of a security or commodity
4) the practice of quoting from books or plays etc.

examples.en: since he lacks originality he must rely on quotation

quote.definition:
1) repeat a passage from
2) name the price of
3) refer to for illustration or proof

examples.en: He quoted the Bible to her
quote prices for cars
He said he could quote several instances of this behavior

quoter.definition: a communicator (speaker or writer) who uses quotations

quotient.definition:
1) the ratio of two quantities to be divided
2) the number obtained by division

qurush.definition: 20 qurush equal 1 riyal in Saudi Arabia
